turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Close. We're so hush-hush, even we know nothing about it.  Now let's see, there's coconut cake, date and walnut; I recommend the rum baba ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Hmmm ...

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Looks like rain, Steed...

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: My number two. Special assignments. She's --

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Let me guess -- 'Father'?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: How curious ...

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Something strange is happening. And whoever knows about it doesn't want us to find out.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Father will be your controller. Steed here will show you the ropes.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Ropes?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Welcome to mobile H.Q. Weather's turning quite nasty. Sir August was blown to smithereens. Along with half of Banffshire.  The Ministry's worried.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: He tried to warn us ...

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Would it be possible to use it for military purposes?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Directed by laser. Bounced by satellite. Quite possible.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: London. The World Council of Ministers meets soon on global defence. If you can control the weather, you control the world.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: After the cold war ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I resign.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: You need treatment, Mrs. Peel.  You can't resign.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Watch me.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: What are you trying to do to me?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: We want to help...!

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I thought I was a widow. My husband ... the only man I ever loved ... is dead. For the rest of my life I have to live with that.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: The death of Peter Peel was a great loss. To us all ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: To you ... ?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Peter Peel was a first class agent. A senior operative. 'X' department Special operations. He was engaged in top secret research. Top priority.  Government approved.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: The Institute ... the funding ...

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: A cover ... for us.  I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Quite frankly ... it could have been you.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: This is an official matter, Mrs. Peel. No need to take it personally. Where are you going?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: To find out who killed my husband.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: The doors and walls are monitored, Mrs. Peel. This is a very secure establishment.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: So am I.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: About your next assignment, Mrs. Peel ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Next assignment?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Ahem. As I was saying, perhaps another macaroon ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Thank you, Steed.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Good luck ... Peter ... Emma.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Thanks, Valentine ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Darling Emma -- yes, we:  the true genius behind the Prospero Project ...

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: A slight miscalculation -- my face was burned beyond recognition. Fortunately my research into plastics came in handy ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Dr. Darling, Peter ... all you ...

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: An unholy trinity ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You killed my husband.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: For starters. Of course I had to kill the Teddy Bears, as well ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Too many cooks --

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Spoil the majority shareholders. In Wonderland Weather. I planned everything, even the Ministry recruiting you ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: But I found you. All the clues led me here ...

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Of course. I planned that, too.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: But -- why?

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: You disappoint me, Emma.  Can't you guess?  For you. It was all for you ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: 'Our revels now are ended.'

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Oh, no, Emma. They've only just begun ...

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Think of this as your second wedding feast ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I'm already married ...

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Come, come, you're a widow -- a most attractive widow. Now I think of it, we'll need a bridesmaid. Here.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: You know, I believe she's actually jealous.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Valentine, listen to me ...

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Right, bridesmaid. Now what have I left out? Oh, yes, I know: the ring.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Ring?

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: That's better. I say, isn't this where you came in? It's impenetrable, by the way ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You're mad.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Entirely. On the other hand  Mad people get things done. Let me show you --

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Such as?

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Destruction of their local weather systems. I can zap a thousand Chernobyls into the air.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: The result would be ...

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Chaos. Transport paralysis. Crop failure.  Economic disaster. Frostbite or sunburn ... on a massive scale. You've seen a few samples...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Then what's stopping you?

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: One very small thing. A diamond 'cyclone' chip. A thousand times more information on a fraction of the size. If I possess that, my powers would be unlimited. My dear half-brother was developing it. But he suspected sabotage. He gave the chip to ... you, 'Mrs.' Peel. I want you. But also your ring.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: The missing piece of the jigsaw. I tried to get you to give it to me as Peter; I tried to steal it from you as Dr. Darling. As myself I'll be a bit less subtle.  With this ring my plan will be complete.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: How Wagnerian ... Do you mean to say you've waited all these years because you couldn't create a chip on your own? That would have amused Peter.

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Speaking of Peter, there's more good news: You won't even have to change your last name. You'll always be Mrs. Peel.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: What are my choices?

turns.speaker: VALENTINE
turns.text: Choices?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I'll never marry you.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Doctor Peel, I presume?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: And you must be Steed. Please don't get up.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I was about to throw in the towel.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I had a spot of bother at the door.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I shouldn't wonder. Not a woman inside Boodles since --

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: 1922. Why the kippers?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Red herring would have been too obvious, don't you think?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: So what was all this -- some sort of test?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Congratulations, you've penetrated a bastion of male privilege. I guessed you weren't a stickler for Tradition, doctor.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Whereas you are.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Dyed in the wool. But I can admire someone who doesn't play by the rules.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Rules are made to be broken.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Not by me. Play by the rules, Doctor, or the game is nothing.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: And just what is the game?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I say, this is all terribly formal. Must I go an calling you Dr. Peel?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Under the circumstances, you may call me Mrs. Peel.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Much better.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: And now that we've settled the matter of honorifics, will you kindly explain why you wished me to meet you?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I didn't. Mother did.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Mother?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: ... Showers followed by sunny periods.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: We're not here to talk about the weather, surely.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Ah ... From Trubshaw's.  My shoemaker.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: A kipper. Or a red herring? What were they investigating?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: My father always wanted a boy.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Really?  I fail to see the connection.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I had a feeling you would. Touche!

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Do you?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Yes indeed. I need protection.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I thought we were on our way.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Oh, absolutely, but Trubshaw's a man worth meeting. No point setting out half shod.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Or half cocked.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Steed, we really must be --

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Ahh. Perfect fit. The luxury of a hand-made shoe. As unique as a face or a fingerprint. Or should I say DNA?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You can but I wish you wouldn't ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Thank you, Trubshaw ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: That place is so absurd, so out of date ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Do you really think so?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You know what I mean. This car -- and you. Nobody walks around like that. Milk?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Not all Tradition is bad, Mrs. Peel. No thank you.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: But why? What's the point?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: A Gentleman has to have a code. This is part of mine. A uniform. Think of it as my suit of shining armor.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: And I suppose you're the knight.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: The most unpredictable piece on the board. And always ready to protect his queen.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: That's predictable. When I find a queen in need of protection I'll let you know.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Sir August Merryweather ... why are we seeing him first?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: As per mother's instructions.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Do we always follow Mother's instructions?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: For a man in my position --

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Just what is your position, if you don't mind my asking.  How did a stuffed shirt like you get into this line of work?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: They call me in when they've reached a dead end. Freelance. Like yourself.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I have no choice. Why should you risk your life?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: After our fencing match, I was rather hoping you would do the risking. More tea?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I meant me.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: According to Mother, Sir August owns half of the Highlands. A millionaire. Former head of Special Projects at the Ministry. Now ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: An eccentric recluse?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Not so much eccentric. More barking mad. He has a wife called June. And a daughter somewhere -- Julie.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: June, July ... August?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: The family does seem to be somewhat meteorologically inclined.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Any other vices?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: All of a piece, really. A fanatical weatherman. Chairman of BROLLY.  British Royal Organisation For Lasting Liquid Years. Thinks British weather has been tampered with by ... aliens.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: So ... I distract him while you snoop around? How?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Small talk.  Try the weather.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Ah, Brenda ...  Mrs. Peel?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You should be dead.  How do you feel?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Strange.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You were very lucky.  Four shots to the heart. I found you after I slipped away from Sir August. Mother brought you here. Not me you should thank.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I wasn't about to.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I mean your man Trubshaw.  Your bullet-proof waistcoat.  I thought you were just overdressed.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I might say the same.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Mother and Dr. Darling have me under observation. They think I tried to kill you.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Why should they think that?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You told them. You said I arrived on a camel, shot you four times. Left you for dead.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Frankly that's how I remember it.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: But that's absurd. I may not be over-fond of you, Steed, but it's not my style.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Perhaps your memory plays tricks, Mrs. Peel.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: That's possible. Sir August was convinced he'd met me before. But I'd never met him. Another odd thing. When it rained, he said it was just as someone had promised.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Did he say who?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: No. But he must know. Incidentally, my double left you with this.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: An invitation. To a 'formal picnic'...?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Did you say formal? I must dress.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I must say, you look more your old self --

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You mean my other self ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Either way ... may I ask: why you dress in that fashion?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I should have thought that was obvious ...  I'm in mourning.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Colonel Crabtree. International Satellite Systems. Formerly of the Ministry.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: How on earth can you tell?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Elementary, Mrs. Peel. Trubshaw isn't the only shoemaker still practicing his trade ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Very good, Steed ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: What on earth?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Any ideas?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Well, he was a fellow of the Royal Zoological Society ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Is that written in his shoe?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Common knowledge, Mrs. Peel ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: She had this in her mouth. There, there...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: For you, Mrs. Peel.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Thanks ...  I see what you mean about letting me do the risking ... Hello?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: But

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Don't bother.  Here's a bus ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Not quite. This is my field.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Is there anything that isn't?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: The Prospero Project was started by my husband. It was an early attempt to solve the problems of global warming. In theory, climate engineering is entirely feasible. We thought of injecting a chemical cocktail into the atmosphere by laser and satellite. A 'quick fix'...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Filling in mother nature's blind spots ... ?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Exactly. There'd been earlier attempts to pump carbon dioxide into deep sea. Propane gas mostly. In small quantities it captures chlorine. Protects the ozone layer. But it proved impractical. Too bulky ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: But if someone miniaturized the process...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: That's what we were working on.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Sounds as if someone's hijacked your research.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Three agents killed by bad weather...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: ... And by you, Mrs. Peel ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Then a mad millionaire. Head of a secret defense establishment. A group of eccentrics obsessed by weather ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: ... And by you, Mrs. Peel. Everything points to you.  No sisters?  No undiscovered twin?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Not that I know of.  Explanation?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: According to Dr. Darling, you're a psychopathic personality with schizophrenic delusions, suffering from recurring amnesia based on traumatic repression, leading to outbursts of anti-social and violent behavior.  Q.E.D.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Is that what you think?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Oh, well ...  Just my type, Mrs. Peel.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Do you always drive this fast?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Have I trespassed on a male prerogative?  We're being followed. I saw him at Trubshaw's ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: What, Lady Disdain? Are you yet breathing?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Barely.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: You will let me know if you find that queen who's in need of protection, won't you?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: This must be the last straw.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Here's the one that broke the camel's back.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Someone didn't want us to get to the party.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I expect we'll have to gatecrash.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Steed ... !

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Mrs. Peel ... ?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Where am I?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: The Winslow Home for Retired Lepidoptorists. I'm so sorry I struck you, Mrs. Peel. Please forgive me. I thought you were someone else ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Was I?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I expect that's for you to know and me to find out ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: It was Peter -- I saw him ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You followed me.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Orders.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: To kill me?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Nothing personal.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I could save you the trouble.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: No trouble.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Because you always obey orders ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Always.  Except ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Yes ... ?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: ... when I don't. It comes down to one thing, Mrs. Peel. Trust.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: And do you trust me?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I could be convinced, if ... I knew who poisoned me in the maze. That kiss ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: It wasn't me; you have my word.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Mmm ... what are you doing?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Keeping a stiff upper lip?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Is that all?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: But you did suspect me.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Not for a moment.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You're playing games.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Aren't we all, Mrs. Peel?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I thought you played by the rules.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I thought you didn't.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I'm playing to win.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Winning isn't everything.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Please don't tell me it's how you play the game.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: After you -- Mrs. Peel ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: No, after you.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: You don't trust me?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: As far as you trust me.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I told Mother I took care of you.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You lied.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I equivocated. But you're not their big worry at present. It's Dr. Darling:  he's disappeared ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Drat. Someone wants to implicate you in this affair, Mrs. Peel. Any idea who?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: No idea who. No idea why ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Teddy bears, cuckoo clocks, toys All children's things ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: ... Or grown-ups, who still like to be children.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Quite. Any childhood friends? Enemies?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Not to speak of. Peter and I were both loners. There was nobody.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Very well. I have a friend who might be of assistance. He's at the Ministry. We'd better be careful.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I'm a wanted woman, I know ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: His name's Jones. 'Invisible' Jones.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Why's he called 'Invisible'?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: You'll find out.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Aren't you coming?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I'll catch you up. Don't worry; he's expecting you.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: We must hurry, Mrs. Peel ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Hurry?  What for?  I'm just now --

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: You didn't tell her?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: There's a reception this evening. Colonel Jones thinks it advisable we attend.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Have we been invited?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: What's that you're wearing?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: It's called Black Leather.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Intoxicating. Here, have one of these.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Limpet bomb. Small, very compact. From Trubshaw's.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: When all this is over, we simply must get you out of that suit.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: You first.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Shall we?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Trubshaw again? What now?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Snuff.  I must insist you try some.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: They're playing your song, Mrs. Peel.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: 'The Merry Widow?' I might have known. Where's the reception?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Bad news. Father's looking for you. Where are those bloody ministers?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Have a look at this.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: I'll be back ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Laying in supplies, Mrs. Peel weather may get very nasty and I've no umbrella ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You needn't bother. I can't drag you further into this. After all, I am still the chief suspect.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: No bother. Mother and Father think I've joined you. I might as well.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: But --

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Oh, and by the way, I think it's about time you got rid of that chip on your shoulder.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: If you'd been through what I have, you wouldn't --

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Mrs. Peel?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: What kept you?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: The plot.  Hello, we must be going ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: 'The owl and the pussycat went to sea -'

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: '... in a beautiful pea green boat...'

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: A fine night, Mrs. Peel ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Still a bit chilly ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: English weather. You know, after all we've been through, I should say we deserve a long holiday ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Have you any place in mind?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: As a matter of fact I have ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I don't recall Siberia being this warm, Steed.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: It's the latest thing, Mrs. Peel.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Our little paradise -- just made for two?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Not quite.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Our chaperon.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Pity your mother came, too ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Ah ... sun tan lotion. Any shops nearby?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Must be. Trubshaw's busy. I'll send Mother ...

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Your mission is simple. Find out how and why these agents died.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I'm no spy -- where do I fit in?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Think of it as special assignment, Mrs. Peel. With a twist. You're our chief suspect.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You're saying I have no choice.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Where's Mother?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Mobile HQ. In a blue funk.  Can't take chances. I'm looking after things while he's hiding out ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: You don't believe him?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: It's Mother you have to convince. He's very agitated.  Wait here.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Emma in Wonderland. Welcome, Mrs. Peel.  We've been expecting you. We hope you'll enjoy your stay with us. Decontamination is almost complete.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Decontamination -- ?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: And you've a new wardrobe. He does want you to look attractive.  He tells me you're very beautiful.

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE JONES
turns.text: Talk to the pipe, Mrs. Peel. That usually helps. Don't worry about me being invisible. Other than that I'm perfectly normal.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE JONES
turns.text: Or rather, you don't. Learnt the tricks in camouflage. Till this accident made a prang of things. How can I help you, Mrs. Peel?

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE JONES
turns.text: Ah, here we are. Steed asked me to play a hunch:  Valentine Peel.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Peter's brother?  But --

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE JONES
turns.text: Half-brother to be precise.

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE JONES
turns.text: Now let's see ... Eton, Cambridge ... research into robotics and plastics. Overtaken by Peter's work on the physics of climate change ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I know all this.

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE JONES
turns.text: Do you also know that during your final experiment, your halfbrother- in-law was under surveillance?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Surveillance? By whom?

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE JONES
turns.text: Father. She gave him an 'all clear' after a security test by Dr. Darling.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Who's now vanished.

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE JONES
turns.text: Makes two of us.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Are you suggesting that Dr. Darling and Valentine were somehow in this together? But that's absurd.

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE JONES
turns.text: I was getting to it.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Getting to what?

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE JONES
turns.text: The World Council of Ministers meets tomorrow to convene the new global defense initiative --

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I fail to see --

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE JONES
turns.text: Under the circumstances Mother didn't see fit, but I think I can get you in ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Well, I can't possibly go like this.

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE JONES
turns.text: 'X' marks the spot. The shoes were delivered to ... an island in Hyde Park. Surrounded by the Serpentine. On the site of a former Ministry installation...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: ... and now?

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE JONES
turns.text: Privately owned by ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Let me guess:  Wonderland Weather.

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE JONES
turns.text: Very good, Mrs. Peel ...

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I shall need a small plane.

turns.speaker: INVISIBLE JONES
turns.text: You're not venturing alone, surely.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I'm going to find out who killed my husband. Will you take these documents to Steed?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: A series of bizarre shifts in local weather patterns ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Global warming?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Jungle plants in the Arctic? A lush English village transformed overnight into African scrubland? Blizzards in summer?

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: We know one thing. That suspect was not Mrs. Peel.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: So you say ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Oh, hello ...

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: We want Mrs. Peel.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Dead, I'm afraid.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Steed

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: How did you guess?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: You reek of Mrs. Peel's Black Leather ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: It was you who gave Valentine Peel his security clearance ... you're the mole who betrayed the Ministry.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Mother betrayed me. She was going to replace me with a younger Father.  Errand boy that's all I was. 'Find Steed...'

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Well, you found me. Have a sniff of this, why don't you? Careful, the scent can be overpowering ...

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Mother. I thought you were burglars.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Brenda and I thought we'd drop in.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Weather's turning nasty.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: You didn't come to talk about the weather, surely.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Oh yes I did. I want you to meet somebody.  I expect you'll like her.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Your research into climate engineering was state-of-the-art. Your experiments could have revolutionized our knowledge of global warming -- had they succeeded. We need your expertise.

turns.speaker: STEED
turns.text: Perhaps I'd better start calling you doctor again, Mrs. Peel --
